flawed_nl_solution:
If Emerie has six quarters, Zain has 6+10 = <<6+10=16>>16 quarters.
At the same time, Zain has 7+10 = <<7+10=14>>14 dimes, ten more than Emerie.
The total number of quarters and dimes Zain has is 14+16 = <<14+16=30>>30 coins.
Zain also has 10 more nickels than Emerie, a total of 10+5 = <<10+5=15>>15 nickels.
In total, Zain has 30+15 = <<30+15=45>>45 coins.
#### 45

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 17, not 14. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
